intro: Diasperus philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy, orange-colored aril. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it plays a role in local biodiversity.
